attributes.action: Reform the Electoral System to Proportional Representation.
attributes.additional_details:
The last election in December 2019 was won on a single issue with a minority of the vote.

More people voted for parties who supported a second referendum than those who voted for Brexit. 

This means that the current Government believe they have a mandate to take us out of the EU when actually they do not. 

Obviously in this instance FPTP has resulted in decisions being made for the whole, by a minority of voters, which seems grossly unfair.

This system needs to change to represent us all.
attributes.background:
Democracy in the UK is broken. 

The current system of First Past The Post fails to represent the views of the majority and can result in a government with a minority perspective.

The devolved nations now have more representative systems in place.
